metadata.synopsis: Default dialogue - the conversation you can have with Shadowheart at any time when she's a member of your party. You can ask her about herself, or events that you've experienced together during your adventures. Her responses to you may differ slightly depending on her current attitude towards you.

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: I... I defied Lady Shar. She won't stand for this... we can talk later - I need to get out of here first.
2.context: NodeContext: A little distracted. Something on her mind.

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: I... I defied Lady Shar. She won't stand for this... we can talk later - I need to get out of here first.
11.context: NodeContext: Worried/can't believe what she just did (spared Nightsong). This occurs right afterwards while still in the Shadowfell, before the consequences of defying Shar have kicked in.

387.speaker: Shadowheart
387.text: I was convinced Lae'zel was had settled on you as her conquest. Brave of you to deny her.

32.speaker: Shadowheart
32.text: Careful - keep seeking me out like this and people may think we're rekindling things. Did you want something?
32.context: NodeContext: Greeting directed at a former lover who still has SH's respect/approval,

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.context: InternalNodeContext: Character saw Astarion use his 'bite' ability on someone else (probably in combat, but not necessarily) and confronts him about being a vampire.NodeContext: Confrontational. Just learned Astarion is a vampire after he bit someone

59.speaker: Shadowheart
59.text: Sometimes I wonder if I should just let the tadpole dictate my love life. Did you want something?
59.context: NodeContext: Greeting directed at a player who is courting her romantically but she doesn't like them very much.

71.speaker: Shadowheart
71.text: I... I failed. I failed Lady Shar. She won't stand for this... we can talk later - I need to get out of here first.
71.context: NodeContext: Worried/can't believe what she just did failed to sacrifice Nightsong). This occurs right afterwards while still in the Shadowfell, before the consequences of defying Shar have kicked in.

105.speaker: Shadowheart
105.context: NodeContext: Intrigued/referring to something seen earlier

109.speaker: Shadowheart
109.context: NodeContext: Intrigued/referring to something seen earlier

117.speaker: Shadowheart
117.context: InternalNodeContext: Character was bitten by Astarion in gameplay.NodeContext: Outraged. Astarion just bit her.

120.speaker: Shadowheart
120.context: NodeContext: A little attitude. Something the player said to her before displeased her.

273.speaker: Narrator
273.text: I'm sorry, but Karlach has won my heart.

520.speaker: Player
520.text: I'm sorry, but Karlach has won my heart.

290.speaker: Shadowheart
290.text: That's one way to put it - careful she doesn't try to steal it to replace her own. But in all seriousness, I'm glad you found someone, even if it isn't me. I hope you make each other happy.

296.speaker: Player
296.text: I'm not a swan - I don't mate for life. I want to be with you and Karlach.

200.speaker: Shadowheart
200.text: I admire your ambition - and your belief in your own stamina - but Karlach deserves to have you to herself. And perhaps there's yet someone out there for me...

125.speaker: Shadowheart
125.text: I don't answer to you - move along.
125.context: NodeContext: Greets the player, but cuts off at the end (she's about to be overcome by a flare-up of magic pain)

136.speaker: Shadowheart
136.text: You know, we had the beginnings of something special once... but it was not meant to be, I suppose. For the best perhaps - I have to dedicate myself to Lady Shar now.
136.context: NodeContext: Greets the player, but cuts off at the end (she's about to be overcome by a flare-up of magic pain)

138.speaker: Shadowheart
138.text: You know, we had the beginnings of something special once... but it was not meant to be, I suppose. For the best perhaps - I have to dedicate myself to Lady Shar now.
138.context: NodeContext: A little awkward/sheepish. She and companion lae'zel came to blows in the night and nearly killed each other, but resolved their differences.

142.speaker: Shadowheart
142.text: You know, we had the beginnings of something special once... but it was not meant to be, I suppose. Perhaps happiness lies elsewhere, for both of us.
142.context: NodeContext: A little awkward/sheepish. She and companion lae'zel came to blows in the night and nearly killed each other, but resolved their differences.

146.speaker: Shadowheart
146.text: I don't think there'll be any more trouble between Lae'zel and I, if you were wondering. We can all sleep easier now - well, apart from all the rest.
146.context: NodeContext: A little awkward/sheepish. She and companion lae'zel came to blows in the night and nearly killed each other, but resolved their differences.

148.speaker: Shadowheart
148.text: I don't think there'll be any more trouble between Lae'zel and I, if you were wondering. We can all sleep easier now - well, apart from all the rest.
148.context: NodeContext: A little awkward/sheepish. She and companion lae'zel came to blows in the night and nearly killed each other, but resolved their differences.

152.speaker: Shadowheart
152.text: I want to talk to you about the other night. I thought we were having a pleasant time... but you cut it short.
152.context: NodeContext: Betraying a little nervousness (soon after her and the player had their first kiss, and their status going forward is not yet known)

159.speaker: Shadowheart
159.text: I want to talk to you about the other night. I thought we were having a pleasant time... but you cut it short.
159.context: NodeContext: Miffed/concerned. The player bailed on their romance scene (skinnydipping) Arc: SH has turned from Shar.

160.speaker: Shadowheart
160.text: Well, my day just improved. Did you want something?
160.context: NodeContext: Greeting directed at a player who is courting her romantically and has her respect/high approval

170.speaker: Shadowheart
170.text: Aren't you a sight for sore eyes.
170.context: NodeContext: Greeting directed at a love interest player who also has SH's respect/high approval

172.speaker: Shadowheart
172.text: Good. I was just starting to miss the sound of your voice.
172.context: NodeContext: Greeting directed at a love interest player who also has SH's respect/high approval

229.speaker: Shadowheart
229.text: I truly wouldn't have faulted you if you wanted Karlach. Those arms are built to sweep someone off their feet.

182.speaker: Shadowheart
182.text: So there's been a mind flayer inside the artefact - or Astral Prism - the whole time we've had it...? Sounds like utter madness, even though I've seen it with my own eyes...
182.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Arc: Shadowheart has committed to Shar

183.speaker: Shadowheart
183.text: So there's been a mind flayer inside the artefact - or Astral Prism - the whole time we've had it...? Sounds like utter madness, even though I've seen it with my own eyes...

351.speaker: Shadowheart
351.text: The more I learn, the less I understand just why I was sent to retrieve that thing... but it matters little now.
351.context: NodeContext: Confused/frustrated, then letting it slide

421.speaker: Shadowheart
421.text: Lady Shar has given me a new mission - and the Prism plays no part in it. In fact, it seems like the Mother Superior's concern alone, and she has strayed from the Dark Lady.

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: She will be in for a rude awakening when I finally stand before her again...

450.speaker: Shadowheart
450.text: But I digress. Did you want something?

202.speaker: Shadowheart
202.text: I do not serve Shar anymore. Nor the Mother Superior. The Prism is no longer my mission - saving my parents is.

337.speaker: Shadowheart
337.text: I do not serve Shar anymore. Nor the Mother Superior. The Prism is no longer my mission. Only the Nightsong can tell me what I must do next.

185.speaker: Shadowheart
185.context: NodeContext: A little sheepish (she will have had a fearful reaction to a wolf in gameplay). Can be applied to any SH arc

212.speaker: Shadowheart
212.context: NodeContext: Considering what comes next. Arc: rejected Shar and euthanized her parenrts.

198.speaker: Player
198.text: Your parents are at peace, and you are free of Shar. What comes next?
198.context: NodeContext: Considering what comes next. Arc: rejected Shar and euthanized her parenrts.

373.speaker: Player
373.text: What about the memories that were taken from you?
373.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. On the cusp of her final reward.

538.speaker: Player
538.text: You saved your parents and stood your ground against Shar - what comes next?
538.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. On the cusp of her final reward.

475.speaker: Player
475.text: What about the memories that were taken from you?
475.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. On the cusp of her final reward.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: You saved your parents and turned from Shar - what comes next?
211.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. On the cusp of her final reward.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: What about the memories that were taken from you?
90.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. On the cusp of her final reward.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You've proved yourself to Lady Shar at last. What now?
42.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. On the cusp of her final reward.

452.speaker: Player
452.text: So have your memories been restored?
452.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. On the cusp of her final reward.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Viconia won't be a problem anymore. What comes now?
154.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. On the cusp of her final reward.

176.speaker: Shadowheart
176.text: The Chamber of Loss beckons. Lady Shar has one final task for me, then all of this will be mine.
176.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. On the cusp of her final reward.

558.speaker: Player
558.text: Viconia won't be a problem anymore. What comes now?

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: My parents are still captive. I need to free them.

426.speaker: Player
426.text: I met with your Mother Superior - she expects me to hand you over to her.
426.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I met the Mother Superior. She wishes to see you, and honour your new place at Shar's side.
107.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

161.speaker: Player
161.text: I met with your Mother Superior. She's willing to negotiate for your parents, if you come with me.
161.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

196.speaker: Player
196.text: It seems your fellow Sharrans can be found at the House of Grief. What now?
196.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

201.speaker: Player
201.text: The Sharrans are using a place called the House of Grief as cover for their presence in Baldur's Gate.
201.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

293.speaker: Player
293.text: You mentioned Sharrans might be watching for us. You want to find them?
293.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

440.speaker: Player
440.text: You mentioned Shar followers might be watching for us. You think we can use them to track down your parents?
440.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

389.speaker: Player
389.text: About our night together, at the beach...
389.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

378.speaker: Player
378.text: About what we did before. The Nightfall ritual...
378.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

181.speaker: Player
181.text: That grave you lingered at before - did it mean something to you?
181.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

110.speaker: Player
110.text: So you had your own little hiding place in the Sharran Cloister? Why?
110.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

312.speaker: Player
312.text: That graffiti we saw - you remember it?
312.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

151.speaker: Player
151.text: |I wanted to talk about us. Do you see us having a future?|
151.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

16.speaker: Player
16.text: About what the Nightsong - Dame Aylin - revealed to you. You must have been shocked.
16.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You don't quite seem to be yourself, of late.
26.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

481.speaker: Player
481.text: You've finally fulfilled your dream, Shadowheart, but what about us? Do we have a future?
481.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

309.speaker: Player
309.text: You've finally fulfilled your dream, Shadowheart, but what about us? Do we have a future?
309.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

268.speaker: Player
268.text: So, you're a Dark Justiciar at last. More than that - Shar herself has chosen you.
268.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

553.speaker: Player
553.text: Is it true, what you said? The curse isn't affecting you?
553.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

557.speaker: Player
557.text: What was that flower you picked?
557.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Remember when you told me Night Orchids were your favourite flowers?
171.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Ketheric Thorm - what do you think of him?
79.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

359.speaker: Player
359.text: What do you make of Ketheric Thorm, now we've seen him in the flesh?
359.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

294.speaker: Player
294.text: So it seems Ketheric Thorm did all he did for his daughter, Isobel. Almost understandable.
294.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

360.speaker: Player
360.text: Something strange happened. That artefact you carry - it seemed to just... come to me.
360.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - box wasn't with SH)

315.speaker: Player
315.text: I wanted to ask about that artefact again. Do you still have it?
315.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the topic was asked about before, but has not been fullly concluded

383.speaker: Player
383.text: That artefact seems to be protecting us somehow. Do you still have it?
383.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice of Absolute scene happened (orpheus box protected player from voice - SH had box)

552.speaker: Player
552.text: What's the story with that odd little artefact you have?
552.context: InternalNodeContext: SH was seen with the box, but the player hasn't yet been protected by the box (voice of absolute scene)

163.speaker: Player
163.text: You said before that you want to become a Dark Justiciar - what does that mean to you?
163.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

22.speaker: Player
22.text: You mentioned before there was something you wanted to share with me?
22.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

178.speaker: Player
178.text: Tell me more about the Mother Superior.
178.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

123.speaker: Player
123.text: There was something you wanted to tell me before.
123.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

537.speaker: Player
537.text: You should eat the noblestalk, Shadowheart - perhaps it could restore your memories.
537.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

303.speaker: Player
303.text: You kept that Idol of Shar from Grymforge, I take it?
303.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

260.speaker: Player
260.text: I found this idol of Shar. Here - perhaps you might want it.
260.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

497.speaker: Player
497.text: You seem eager to find out more about these Dark Justiciars in the Underdark.
497.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

288.speaker: Player
288.text: You seemed intrigued when Halsin mentioned Dark Justiciars before.
288.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

439.speaker: Player
439.text: Why were you in pain before?
439.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

446.speaker: Player
446.text: Why were you in pain before?
446.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

162.text: Why were you in pain before?
162.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

518.speaker: Player
518.text: Why were you in pain before?
518.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

86.speaker: Player
86.text: These... flare-ups you're experiencing. I'm concerned.
86.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

187.speaker: Player
187.text: Help me understand this wound of yours, Shadowheart.
187.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

218.speaker: Player
218.text: Your wound is causing you too much pain, Shadowheart. There must be a way to heal it.
218.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Those ruins we spied in the distance from the Gyrmforge - they mean something to you?
115.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

132.speaker: Player
132.text: Those murals in the Grove - something about them seemed to catch your eye.
132.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

44.speaker: Player
44.text: There's something you're not telling me - I'm sure of it.
44.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only be chosen once - subsequently, everything before the persuasion options should be skipped

317.speaker: Player
317.text: I still think you're keeping something from me.
317.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

477.speaker: Player
477.text: I have to know what you're hiding from me. It's important.
477.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

323.speaker: Player
323.text: I want to talk about your Shar worship. Your faith and mine might share a great deal.
323.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

504.speaker: Player
504.text: I want to talk about your Shar worship.
504.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: So - you worship Shar, and I serve Selûne... dare I ask how you feel about that?
285.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

414.speaker: Player
414.text: My memories are all gone. Is your tadpole playing tricks on yours?
414.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

428.speaker: Player
428.text: I yearn to kill. I only feel like myself when I'm killing.
428.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: What happened to Alfira - I wasn't responsible.
75.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

284.speaker: Player
284.text: I nearly did something terrible to you once... I'm afraid I won't be able to stop myself, next time.
284.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

532.speaker: Player
532.text: I have been gifted with the Slayer, a form most evil.
532.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Last Light has been reduced to a feast of death and pain... glorious.
25.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

347.speaker: Player
347.text: I understand my affliction at last - I am a Bhaalspawn. The Lord of Murder compels me.
347.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

516.speaker: Player
516.text: My affliction is no more - I'm finally free.
516.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: Bhaal has chosen me to conquer all of existence in his name. You would be wise to bow.
238.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: We should talk about our confrontation.
143.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: I want to talk about what happened with Lae'zel.
131.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

549.speaker: Player
549.text: Apologies for my... indiscretion before. I allowed my stomach to rule my head.
549.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Maybe your fatigue is due to the tadpole.
36.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

255.speaker: Player
255.text: You've suffered from broken rest. Fatigue is to be expected.
255.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

355.speaker: Player
355.text: You feel unwell? Could it be the tadpole...?
355.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Consider telling Shadowheart that you are a vampire spawn.
21.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

116.speaker: Player
116.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

399.speaker: Player
399.text: About that night we stayed up together...
399.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

466.speaker: Player
466.text: Did I miss something before? When I asked you about the night we spent together, you hesitated.
466.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

449.speaker: Player
449.text: You mentioned I've said or done things to give you doubts - like what?
449.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

529.speaker: Player
529.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

261.speaker: Player
261.text: I want to get to know you more, Shadowheart.
261.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You and I... we share something special, I think. I want to talk about it.
9.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

536.speaker: Player
536.text: Tell me about your fear of wolves.
536.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

214.speaker: Player
214.text: I wanted to talk about our relationship.
214.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

150.text: I wanted to talk to you about us, and... exclusivity in our relationship.
150.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

156.speaker: Player
156.text: What do you think of all that's happened to us so far?
156.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

190.speaker: Player
190.text: I want to talk about all that's happened to us.
190.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

313.speaker: Player
313.text: We should get to know each other a little more.
313.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

425.speaker: Player
425.text: I can't help but feel you and I might have missed a chance to connect. Truly connect.
425.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

375.speaker: Player
375.text: I can't help but feel you and I might have missed a chance to connect. Truly connect.
375.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

252.speaker: Player
252.text: These illithid powers we're developing - what do you make of them?
252.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

498.speaker: Player
498.text: I think that special tadpole the Emperor offered will increase our chances of success.
498.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

523.speaker: Player
523.text: I'm sorry, Shadowheart. I want to be with Lae'zel, not you.
523.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

240.speaker: Player
240.text: I'm sorry, Shadowheart. I've chosen to be with Gale over you.
240.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I've fallen for Wyll. What you and I had... it has to end. I'm sorry.
27.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

463.speaker: Player
463.text: Shadowheart... Karlach has won my heart. I'm sorry, but what we had has to end.
463.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

394.speaker: Player
394.text: You and I had the beginning of something together... but I want Astarion. I'm sorry.
394.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

295.speaker: Player
295.text: We shared the beginnings of a romance for a while... but we never really pursued it, did we?
295.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

213.speaker: Shadowheart
213.text: I suppose we didn't. Another life perhaps.
213.context: NodeContext: No harm done/beginnings of romance fizzled out

455.speaker: Player
455.text: I take it you heard what happened between Astarion and I?
455.context: NodeContext: Sincere/romantic. Reacting to being asked to stay at camp for now by the player, her love interest. Player shouldn't feel too bad about dismissing her - she's understanding.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I take it you heard what happened between Karlach and I?

271.speaker: Player
271.text: I've fallen for Lae'zel. I want to be with her.

43.speaker: Shadowheart

302.speaker: Shadowheart

409.speaker: Player

527.speaker: Shadowheart

139.speaker: Shadowheart

45.speaker: Shadowheart

45.context: NodeContext: Tiny hint of regret. Wasn't meant to be.

511.speaker: Player

208.speaker: Shadowheart

3.speaker: Shadowheart

144.speaker: Shadowheart

330.speaker: Shadowheart

465.speaker: Shadowheart
465.text: I won't begrudge Gale for winning you over. He does try awfully hard.

438.speaker: Shadowheart

331.speaker: Shadowheart

331.context: NodeContext: Shar path. Taken aback. Perhaps not entirely sure if this is a good thing or not.

343.speaker: Shadowheart

234.speaker: Shadowheart

10.speaker: Shadowheart

99.speaker: Player

492.speaker: Shadowheart

434.speaker: Shadowheart

258.speaker: Player

306.speaker: Player

209.speaker: Player

28.speaker: Shadowheart

427.speaker: Shadowheart

15.speaker: Shadowheart

140.speaker: Shadowheart
140.text: I wish I'd never been sent on this mission. It had better be worth it.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: It seems to be important to your Mother Superior.

325.speaker: Shadowheart
325.text: Yes. And she acts as Lady Shar's voice amongst mortals. She must be doing the Nightsinger's bidding... I just don't know what it all means.

388.speaker: Shadowheart
388.text: You'll have to live with that curiosity for now, I'm afraid. Let's just concentrate on ridding ourselves of these tadpoles.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Your mission is irrelevant to me.

155.speaker: Shadowheart
155.text: Stay ignorant then. Just don't compromise me.

304.speaker: Player

89.speaker: Shadowheart
89.text: All will be revealed in due time. I hope.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Whatever happens, we'll be able to manage.

334.speaker: Shadowheart
334.text: I've seen them at work before. I wasn't alone in my mission - all those who were sent with me were slain by githyanki blades.

540.speaker: Player
540.text: Perhaps you would have fewer reservations had you not stolen from us.

535.speaker: Shadowheart
535.text: I am not going to offer apologies for doing as I was commanded to.

316.speaker: Player

400.speaker: Shadowheart

429.speaker: Shadowheart

195.speaker: Player

134.speaker: Shadowheart
134.text: Still... there may be more to it. I need to keep alert, in case that suspicion amounts to anything.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: Perhaps your predecessors and mine came to blows around here, sometime long ago.

246.speaker: Shadowheart
